description_preview: Continue exploring to learn more about Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais, a reciter renowned for his remarkable talent and achievements.
biblio_en:
Sheikh Abdul Rahman Bin Abdul Aziz Al-Sudais who is known as (Al-Sudais), one of the most famous reciters of the Qur'an in the Islamic world, his pure unique voice sends calm and peace in souls, his voice and his name are linked to al-Masjid al-Ḥarām (Great Mosque of Mecca) and Holy Mecca where he was appointed as imam of the Great Mosque in Mecca since 1983 / 1404 where the sheikh leads the prayers and delivers sermons and lessons proving acceptance of his mother's prayer and wish when he was young.
In 2012 / 1433, a royal decree was issued by King Abdullah Bin Abdul Aziz - may God have mercy on him - which provides for the appointment of sheikh as General President for the Affairs of the Two Holy Mosques. 
Childhood of Al-Sudais helped in formation of his character and his great fate. He was born in Al-baqieria, Qusim in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in 1960 / 1328 in a family that loved Qur'an, then he moved with his family to live inside the city of Riyadh, where he learned Quran with proper tajweed before completing his 12th year in a clear indication on his intelligence and brilliance.
Sheikh Al-Sudais finished basic education in Riyadh and then decided to join the Riyadh Scientific Institution and finished his study there with excellent degree; it was the last station before the beginning of the university life. He decided to join the Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Studies at the University of Imam Muhammad bin Saud, he specialized in the science of Fiqh in which he got the Master's degree and a PH.D later from Umm Al-Qura University in Mecca, where he works now as a Fiqh professor.
Sheikh Al-Sudais holds many other positions such as supervision on Imam Aldaa'wah foundation which is a scientific islamic institution interested in the sciences of the Qur'an besides charity activities.
In recognition of his efforts, sheikh Al-Sudais won overwhelming popularity in the Islamic world, and has given many awards, perhaps the most prominent one is Dubai International Holy Qur'an Award's "Islamic Personality Of the Year" in 2005 / 1426.
Sheikh Al-Sudais also manages the Knowledge International University (KIU), a Saudi University for the sciences of Qur'an and sharia, it has a great staff of the most prominent Islamic figures.
biblio_fr:
Abdul Rahman Al Sudais est le premier imam de la Grande mosquée de la ville islamique, La Mecque. C'est un grand réciteur du saint coran de renommée internationale.

D'origine du Clan Anza, Abdul Rahman Al Sudais est né en Arabie Saoudite.

Abdul Rahman Al Sudais a pu mémoriser le coran alors qu'il n'avait que 12 ans. Il a décroché son diplôme en 1979 de l'institution scientifique 'Riyad' avec la mention 'Excellent'.

En 1983, Abdul Rahman Al Sudais a entamé ses études à l'université où il a obtenu un diplôme de la charia et une maîtrise de la charia à l'université islamique de l'imam Muhammad ben Saud en 1987.

Par la suite, il a décroché son doctorat en charia islamique de l'université "Umm al-Qura" en 1995.

Abdul Rahman Al Sudais est connu pour la particularité de sa voix affective et sa psalmodie (Tajwid) éblouissante du saint coran. il a reçu le prix de "la personnalité islamique de l'année" dans le 9ème Award annuel international de la récitation du coran à Dubai en 2005.
biblio_ar:
الشيخ عبد الرحمن بن عبد العزيز السديس و المشهور بالشيخ السديس أحد أشهر قراء القرآن علي مستوى العالم الإسلامي صاحب الصوت العذب الذي يبعث الهدوء في النفس ، يرتبط صوته واسمه ببيت الله الحرام ومكة المكرمة حيث تم تعيينه إماماً للحرم المكي منذ عام 1983 / 1404 حيث يؤم الشيخ المصلين و يلقي الخطب و الدروس و في ذلك تحقيق لدعاء والدة الشيخ عندما كان صغيراً. عام 2012 / 1433 ، صدر مرسوم ملكي من الملك عبد الله بن عبدالعزيز – رحمه الله - تم بموجبه تعيين الشيخ السديس في منصب الرئيس العام للمسجد الحرام والمسجد النبوي.
ساهمت نشأة السديس في تكوين ما هو عليه الآن فقد ولد في محافظة البكيرية بمنطقة القصيم بالمملكة العربية السعودية عام 1960 / 1328 في أسرة محافظة ومحبة للقرآن الكريم، و انتقلت أسرته للعيش داخل مدينة الرياض حيث حفظ القرآن هناك كاملاً مع التجويد السليم دون أن يتجاوز الثانية عشرة  من عمره في دلالة واضحة على ذكاء و ألمعية الشيخ منذ نعومة أظافره.
أنهى الشيخ السديس تعليمه الأساسي في الرياض إذ نال شهادته الثانوية من أحد مدارسها قرر بعدها الالتحاق بمعهد الرياض العملي و أنهى دراسته فيه بدرجة امتياز، و قد كانت تلك المحطة الأخيرة قبل بداية حياته الجامعية إذ قرر الالتحاق بكلية الشريعة و الدرسات الإسلامية بجامعة الإمام محمد بن سعود الإسلامية و تخصص في علم أصول الفقه الذي نال فيه درجة الماجستير ثم الدكتوراه لاحقاً من جامعة أم القرى بمكة المكرمة حيث يعمل فيها حالياً أستاذاً لأصول الفقه.
يشغل الشيخ السديس العديد من المناصب الأخرى مثل إشرافه على "مجمع إمام الدعوة" و هي مؤسسة إسلامية علمية تهتم بعلوم القرآن الكريم بجانب أنشتطها الإنسانية و الخيرية، و تقديراً لمجهودات الشيخ السديس حاز شعبية طاغية في أرجاء العالم الإسلامي و قد منح العديد من الجوائز لعل أبرزها جائزة “الشخصية الإسلامية لعام 2005 / 1426” من مؤسسة  دبي الدولية للقرآن الكريم.
يدير الشيخ السديس كذلك جامعة المعرفة العالمية KIU وهي جامعة سعودية لتدريس علوم القرءان و الشريعة و تضم هيئة التدريس فيها العديد من أبرز الشخصيات الإسلامية.
biblio_html_en:
Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais is a name that echoes through the halls of mosques and homes around the globe, a voice that has become synonymous with the recitation of the Quran in its most sublime form. Born in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in 1960, Al-Sudais has not only become one of the most eminent Quran reciters of our time but also a prominent Islamic figure whose impact transcends cultural and geographical boundaries. His journey from a young enthusiast of Quranic recitation to the Chief Imam of the Grand Mosque in Mecca is a testament to his unwavering faith, profound dedication, and exceptional talent.

Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais grew up in a family that held deep respect for Islamic scholarship and Quranic studies. His passion for Quran recitation was evident from an early age. He pursued his Islamic education with zeal, graduating from the Al Imam Mohamed Ibn Saud Islamic University in Riyadh, furthering his studies in Sharia at Umm al-Qura University, and eventually obtaining a Ph.D. in Islamic Sharia from the Islamic University of Madinah.

Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais: Rise to Prominence

Al-Sudais' rise to international recognition began with his appointment as an Imam at the Grand Mosque in Mecca, a role he has held since 1984. His recitations, characterized by a profound emotional depth and impeccable clarity, have moved millions. Whether during the Taraweeh prayers in Ramadan or the annual Hajj pilgrimage, his voice has drawn people closer to the divine message of the Quran.

The influence of Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais extends beyond the confines of recitation. He has played a significant role in promoting peace, understanding, and unity within the Muslim community and beyond. Through his position, he has addressed issues of extremism, called for harmony among Muslims, and engaged in interfaith dialogue to foster mutual respect among different religions.

Recognition and Awards of Al-Sudais

Al-Sudais' contributions to Islam and Quranic recitation have earned him numerous accolades and awards from Islamic institutions and governments worldwide, reflecting the broad appreciation of his efforts to enrich Islamic spiritual life.

Apart from his duties as an Imam, Al-Sudais has been instrumental in the establishment of educational programs and institutions aimed at promoting Quranic sciences and Islamic studies, nurturing the next generation of scholars and reciters.

Al-Sudais is also known for his humanitarian work, particularly in advocating for the welfare of Muslims in conflict zones. His efforts underscore the importance of compassion and assistance to those in need, in line with Islamic principles.

Abdul Rahman Al-Sudais’ Influence: A List of Key Contributions

  • Impeccable Quran Recitation: Al-Sudais is renowned for his beautiful, precise, and emotionally charged recitation of the Quran, which has touched the hearts of millions around the world.

  • Leadership at the Grand Mosque: As the Chief Imam of the Grand Mosque in Mecca, he has led millions of Muslims in prayer, offering guidance and spiritual leadership.

  • Promotion of Peace and Unity: Through his speeches and sermons, Al-Sudais has consistently advocated for peace, unity, and understanding both within the Muslim community and between different faiths.

  • Educational Initiatives: He has played a pivotal role in establishing and supporting Quranic schools and Islamic educational programs, contributing significantly to the spread of Islamic knowledge.

  • Humanitarian Work: Al-Sudais has actively participated in and promoted humanitarian causes, emphasizing the Islamic duty to aid those in need, regardless of their background.

  • Interfaith Dialogue: He has engaged in dialogue with leaders of other faiths, promoting mutual respect, understanding, and coexistence among diverse religious communities.

  • Authorship: Abdul Rahman has authored several books on Islamic jurisprudence and Quranic interpretation, contributing to the academic and spiritual discourse on Islam.

  • Global Islamic Influence: Through his recitations, available in recordings and online, he has played a crucial role in making the Quran accessible to a global audience, inspiring countless individuals to explore the depths of Islamic teachings.

Abdul Rahman is a prominent figure in the world of Islam. He showed that a person who is dedicated to his work can not only carry teachings and share knowledge with the whole world, but also solve problems, difficulties and injustices that are encountered on the path to achieving happiness and spiritual well-being.
